body.name: ASUS Dual GeForce RTX™ 4060 Ti White OC Edition 8GB GDDR6 (PCIe 4.0, 8GB GDDR6, DLSS 3, HDMI 2.1, DisplayPort 1.4a, Axial-tech Fan Design, 0dB Technology, and More)
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 11 hrs 2 mins
features: Powered by NVIDIA DLSS3, ultra-efficient Ada Lovelace arch, and full ray tracing
4th Generation Tensor Cores: Up to 4x performance with DLSS 3 vs. brute-force rendering
3rd Generation RT Cores: Up to 2x ray tracing performance
Axial-tech fan design features a smaller fan hub that facilitates longer blades and a barrier ring that increases downward air pressure
New White Design: For PC builds that need a white GPU to match your gaming machine
body.description: The ASUS Dual RTX 4060 Ti White OC Edition has arrived! Loaded with the latest NVIDIA technologies such as DLSS 3 and RTX ray tracing this GPU will provide excellent performance for those looking to build the perfect entry-level PC. Upgraded with the latest Axial tech and Dual Ball bearing fans, this card provides longevity and durability.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.7 4.7 out of 5 stars 550 ratings 4.7 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stylish and works great.
reviews.reviewText: It's true that this isn't a huge upgrade from the 3060 Ti it's supposed to replace... I wish it had at least a 160bit bus and 10GB of VRAM but it is what it is... in Cyberpunk running DLSS 3 and Frame Gen you can easily get over 100fps at 1440p it has lower power draw and this is a very decent and stylish cooler model. It's definitely worth the upgrade if you prefer Nvidia and you have an older card like the 3060 or 20 series or lower... if you have a 3060 ti or higher just undervolt and stick with your card until something better comes along...Overall I like this card a lot and it has great performance at 1080p and 1440p and would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like this card it plays games just fine at 1440p smooth quiet doesn't get as hot as my amd card don't believe those as seen on YouTube videos these people r just benchmarkers acting like they know everything benchmarks r pointless lol.. it goes by how you use the card real word performance matters not geek marks ..it's a good card and worth the money 💰🤑

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I read the reviews and everyone's views on the 30 series vs. this one. It was a simple choice for me. I had a 650w power supply and the 3060ti required a 750w. This one would run with a 650w PSU. So, rather than save a $100 on the 3060ti and spend another $150-$200 on a new PSU, I bought this.It has met all of my expectations and more. I should mention, I have an ultra-wide 1080p monitor, a side regular 1080p monitor, and a 1080p TV all hooked up to this GPU. It runs all well, is stable, and I get good fps. 100+ on my main game, Hunt: Showdown on high settings. I probably could get higher fps and smoother play with a newer CPU and motherboard (current: 9900k and z390-pro) but that's something I need to save for. All-in-all, if you want a solid performing 1080p card with a lower power draw, this is a great card. If you can spring for the 4070, and need 1440p resolution, go for it, but don't hate on this card. It's solid for what it is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really nice GPU for non-gamers
reviews.reviewText: I'm not a gamer at all, but I did want a modern GPU with all the ray-tracing and tensor cores possible for 3D rendering, video rendering, and photo processing without getting one of those insane workstation cards with 6x the RAM. I'm not a professional, I don't need all that. This does wonderful! I have converted 4K video in record time and it runs adobe programs like Illustrator and Premier like a champ.I like that it doesn't have insane power requirements so I was able to get by with a 750 watt PSU with plenty of overhead. I love the Studio ready drivers that are optimized for creative applications. I also like that this card is simply designed with no RGB LED everywhere. You can keep a desktop setup looking professional and clean but still show off that GeForce RTX badging if you like.Install was uneventful in that I had absolutely no issues with the card itself. Once I got the system booting and Windows loaded, installing the drivers was easy and everything is working great. Plenty of outputs for future expansion if I want.Hopefully I'll get many years out of this card before the next big thing comes out. Until then, it is a great card for someone who doesn't game but doesn't want to be limited with creator applications. It could probably game really well too as long as you aren't trying to max-out settings on modern games with 120Hz at 4k.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Good card. Quiet. Easy to overclock only issue it could use a wider memory bus.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Performance and Versatility: ASUS Dual NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 Ti White OC Edition
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the ASUS Dual NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 Ti White OC Edition Graphics Card, and I must say it has exceeded my expectations in every aspect. From its sleek white design to its outstanding performance, this graphics card truly delivers an exceptional gaming experience.First and foremost, the performance of this graphics card is simply outstanding. Whether I'm exploring vibrant open worlds or engaging in intense battles, the graphics are incredibly detailed and smooth. Secondly, I have used both the HDMI and DisplayPort connections, and I'm pleased to report that both work flawlessly.In conclusion, the ASUS Dual NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 Ti White OC Edition Graphics Card is a top-notch choice for gamers seeking exceptional performance and versatility. Its powerful hardware, reliable connectivity options, and efficient cooling system make it a standout option in the market. Whether you're a casual gamer or a dedicated enthusiast, this graphics card is definitely worth the investment. I wholeheartedly give it a 5-star rating.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent choice for the money
reviews.reviewText: Got this for my son for Christmas and it works perfectly! Awesome card!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Plays Star Citizen well and very compatible with Windows.
reviews.reviewText: I don't game a lot, but when I do, it is star Citizen. :-) It plays this game very well. (AMD Rysen 5 5600X 32gb RAM). Consistently high telemetry @ 51 FPS. Highest is same card with Ryzen 8 5800X. Card is ALWAYS cool with AMD fan and always quiet.
Buen producto, la disipación de calor es muy buena

I had some troubles getting this card to work. But then I realized my power supply wasn't strong enough so I upgraded the power supply to a 1200 Watt power supply and now it seems to be working well. At first I thought my motherboard was not compatible with this graphics card. But it is. And it's running smoothly so far. I can run games well on this. It is hopefully future proof for games in the future. It runs games at high frame rates. So far so good.
Bought the 4060 ti put in my computer and it works great so much better and faster than the 1070 8gb it replaced would def recommend
Great graphics card for 1080p @ 144hz max settings. Huge step up from my 1660 super I previously had. Card looks great as well. Definitely worth the money
